title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to lay off 20% of staff as it restructures operations with its Viator brand.
The reorganization includes combining Tripadvisor and Viator to become an AI-enabled, experience-led company.
The company aims for $85 million in cost savings and increased focus on travel experiences.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Abandoned tent discovered at Valley Way tent site in New Hampshire's White Mountains, no missing hiker reports filed.
Search team found car keys with Apple AirTag near tent; no matching vehicle located at nearby trailheads.
Posts on hiker Facebook groups about tent drew speculation but provided no definitive information on its owner.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, ex-Patriots cheerleader, founded CharityTeams to help nonprofits raise $42 million through athletic events.
Hurley trained Boston Marathon runners for 18 years, creating signature events like the Superhero 17 and Hop 21 runs.
Susan Hurley passed from ovarian cancer, survived by two sons and fiancé Barry Foland; Celebration of Life on November 8.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket has launched a new lager in collaboration with Vermont's Zero Gravity Beer.
The 'More For Your Dollar' lager 12-pack is priced at $12.99 and available at select Market Basket locations.
The beer is sold in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire at MB Spirits, MB Beer & Wine, and other stores.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court reviews potential for judges to increase pay for court-appointed attorneys amid public defender work stoppage.
Over 900 defendants remain unrepresented despite a legislative pay raise aimed at ending the public defender work stoppage.
Defense attorneys advocate for court intervention, while opponents argue it breaches separation of powers within Massachusetts government.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston to sign copies of her debut novel, 'Gone Before Goodbye.'
Witherspoon participated in a discussion at Harvard Business School, reminiscing about her role in the movie 'Legally Blonde.'
She discussed her business, Reese’s Book Club, highlighting the importance of women-centered stories by female authors.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, a Springfield-based aide to Gov. Maura Healey, was arrested and charged with cocaine trafficking.
Republican lawmakers are questioning Governor Healey's hiring process and demand details on Cook's 2023 recruitment.
GOP gubernatorial candidates criticize Healey's administration, calling for an independent investigation into her vetting practices.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a car crash in New Bedford.
Massachusetts State Police found a 2019 Honda Civic in a wooded area off Route 140 South with two ejected teens.
The 18-year-old driver from Dartmouth survived with non-life-threatening injuries; the crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos seeking help to identify a suspect in a series of commercial burglaries since August.
The suspect allegedly used a pry tool to access businesses in downtown Boston, taking credit cards, cash, and electronics.
Related incidents have been reported by police at Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University, with the latest on Sept. 25.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans were reportedly unwilling to trade with the Patriots due to tensions with coach Mike Vrabel.
Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk allegedly holds negative feelings about Vrabel's departure, affecting trade decisions.
Mike Vrabel, former Titans coach, joined the Patriots after a year with the Browns, winning NFL Coach of the Year.
